name: CAIR FOUNDATION INC
mission: Communications Department works in conjunction with local and national media to ensure an accurate portrayal of Islam and Muslims is presented to the American public.
theoryOfChange: CAIR uses a combination of legal defense, media monitoring, and government lobbying to protect constitutional rights and shift the public narrative around Islam.
zakatClaimEvidence: Friend, please support CAIR's work today with your tax deductible and zakat eligible donation. ... Please consider this contribution as my Zakat. ... Numerous Muslim scholars have confirmed that Zakat is payable to organizations that exist to serve the Muslim community by protecting their rights. This is because the work done by CAIR (and other such organizations) can be classified as fi-sabilillah, which is one of the eight categories of Zakat recipients detailed in the Quran (Chapter 9, Verse 60). (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEwXZfUhJ9UiodNOdSQtAf_KE-jRNEYCbkgcyLIetSOABIa70Wt9n0lrNH0SRNWrd8A2IvvvXDsdcBoSW0Nsh1RqH_O0PBVVhDYkbJzXplBsAWeFHe6Q5KboSs=)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

score_details.score_summary: CAIR FOUNDATION INC shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Friend, please support CAIR's work today with your tax deductible and zakat eligible donation. ... Please consider this contribution as my Zakat. ... Numerous Muslim scholars have confirmed that Zakat is payable to organizations that exist to serve the Muslim community by protecting their rights. This is because the work done by CAIR (and other such organizations) can be classified as fi-sabilillah, which is one of the eight categories of Zakat recipients detailed in the Quran (Chapter 9, Verse 60). (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEwXZfUhJ9UiodNOdSQtAf_KE-jRNEYCbkgcyLIetSOABIa70Wt9n0lrNH0SRNWrd8A2IvvvXDsdcBoSW0Nsh1RqH_O0PBVVhDYkbJzXplBsAWeFHe6Q5KboSs=)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a score of 98.33333333333333/100 and focuses on civil rights and media relations.
Total revenue reached $7,942,722 with a program expense ratio of 66.4% and 11.4 months of working capital.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides multiple donation options for supporters.
The foundation offers engagement opportunities for volunteers to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains an overall GMG score of 62/100, reflecting exceptional financial transparency and health despite moderate scores in program impact and donor alignment.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 66.4% indicates room to increase direct service spending relative to administrative costs
Limited direct evidence of cost-per-beneficiary metrics for advocacy-based programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 29/50, the organization addresses the urgent cause of civil rights advocacy for Muslims [1]. However, the donor fit is categorized as low, suggesting that while the mission is critical, the specific program structure may not align with every individual donor's preference for direct-aid interventions [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a capacity-building approach to impact, focusing on systemic advocacy and media relations rather than direct service delivery [1]. While it maintains a high data confidence level, the nature of advocacy work results in a moderate impact score of 33/50 due to the difficulty of measuring specific cost-per-beneficiary outcomes [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: CAIR Foundation Inc. serves as a leading advocate for the American Muslim community through civil rights defense and media representation.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100
Strong liquidity with 11.4 months of working capital available
Efficient fundraising operations costing only $0.19 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: The CAIR Foundation Inc. operates a comprehensive communications department to ensure an accurate portrayal of Islam while managing programs in civil rights defense, research, and advocacy [1][2]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving methods [3].
